subject: Re: [junit] Problems using @BeforeClass with parallel methods
msgSnippet: Hi, I think, you must  use @Before annotation for run before any of the @Test methods contained in the same class. @BeforeClass annotated method runs once at

Hi,

I think, you must  use @Before annotation for run before any of the @T=
est
methods contained in the same class. @BeforeClass annotated method runs=
 once
at the class initialize.



2011/2/9 cowwoc2001 <cowwoc@....=
org>

>
>
> Hi,
>
> It is my understanding that @BeforeClass is supposed to=
 run before any of
> the @Test methods contained in the same class. When I =
run my code in
> sequential mode, everything works fine, but when I enable =
parallel mode I am
> seeing that @BeforeClass no longer runs before the tes=
ts.
>
> I am using JUnit 4.8.1 using this POM configuration under Maven:
>
=
> <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
> <artifactId>maven-surefire-=
plugin</artifactId>
> <version>2.7.1</version>
> <configuration>
> <exclude=
s>
> <exclude>**/TestConfiguration.java</exclude>
> </excludes>
> <parallel=
>methods</parallel>
> </configuration>
>
> Any ideas?
>
> Thank you,
> Gili=
